title: Exeter Cathedral to host 'spiritual' underwater video game service inspired by Jonah and the Whale
text:
First, bats were mooted as a tool for mission. Then Cathedrals began installing helter skelters and golf courses to entice people through their doors.

Now the word of God is being spread with the help of video games.

This Sunday Exeter Cathedral will play host to a technology-enriched service which will see congregants play an underwater game which should lead them into “contemplating the depths of Jonah”.

The ancient cathedral, which opened in 1400, is hosting the traditional Sunday service - but with a twist - in order to fuse technology and spirituality. This “virtual journey” will be run by Andy Robertson, a former theology student who now works as a video game journalist.

The service will see congregants playing the aquatic adventure game, ‘Abzû’ - billed as “an epic descent into the depths of the sea”. The game will be projected on a large screen in real time while attendants pass around the controller and gave a go at navigating the onscreen diver through virtual oceans.
